      # File railties/lib/rails/generators/generated_attribute.rb, line 8
 8:       def initialize(name, type)
 9:         raise Thor::Error, "Missing type for attribute '#{name}'.\nExample: '#{name}:string' where string is the type." if type.blank?
10:         @name, @type = name, type.to_sym
11:       end
Public Instance methods
default()

[ show source ]

      # File railties/lib/rails/generators/generated_attribute.rb, line 26
26:       def default
27:         @default ||= case type
28:           when :integer                     then 1
29:           when :float                       then 1.5
30:           when :decimal                     then "9.99"
31:           when :datetime, :timestamp, :time then Time.now.to_s(:db)
32:           when :date                        then Date.today.to_s(:db)
33:           when :string                      then "MyString"
34:           when :text                        then "MyText"
35:           when :boolean                     then false
36:           when :references, :belongs_to     then nil
37:           else
38:             ""
39:         end
40:       end
field_type()

[ show source ]

      # File railties/lib/rails/generators/generated_attribute.rb, line 13
13:       def field_type
14:         @field_type ||= case type
15:           when :integer, :float, :decimal then :text_field
16:           when :time                      then :time_select
17:           when :datetime, :timestamp      then :datetime_select
18:           when :date                      then :date_select
19:           when :text                      then :text_area
20:           when :boolean                   then :check_box
21:           else
22:             :text_field
23:         end
24:       end

      # File railties/lib/rails/generators/generated_attribute.rb, line 42
42:       def human_name
43:         name.to_s.humanize
44:       end
reference?()

[ show source ]

      # File railties/lib/rails/generators/generated_attribute.rb, line 46
46:       def reference?
47:         [ :references, :belongs_to ].include?(self.type)
48:       end
